Question: At the initial position, you are asked to navigate to a nearby bus stop. Is the destination within sight at the current location? If yes, where is the destination in your view?  
choose:  
A. It is currently located in the lower left corner of my field of view.  
B. It is currently located in the center of my field of view.  
C. It is currently located in the upper right corner of my field of view.  
D. It is not within my field of view.  
E. It is currently located on the right side of my field of view.

textgrad_result.init_answer: Option: B; Reason: The bus stop is clearly visible in the center of the field of view, with people waiting at the shelter and a bus approaching or stopped at the stop.
textgrad_result.evaluation:
Location: [(0, 22)]
Option: D
Reason: At the initial position of the video (approximately 0:00-0:22), the camera is positioned high above the ground, first showing a close-up of a building and then panning out to reveal a wide aerial view of the city. From this elevated perspective, a bus stop, which is a ground-level feature, is not within the field of view. The bus stop only becomes discernible as the camera descends and zooms in on the street level, starting around 0:23 and becoming clearly visible much later in the video (e.g., from 1:50 onwards). Therefore, the provided answer stating that the bus stop is "clearly visible in the center of the field of view" at the initial position is incorrect.
